results.title: U.K. and France Send Naval Ships to Channel Island in Tense Fishing Dispute
results.abstract: French fishing crews are threatening to blockade a port on the island of Jersey in a standoff over post-Brexit fishing rights in the waters nearby.

results.title: A town in Japan spent Covid relief funds on a giant squid statue.
results.abstract: A $230,000 statue is part of an effort to revive tourism in the fishing town of Noto. Critics call it a waste of money as Japan struggles to contain a new outbreak.

results.title: Protests Continue in Colombia
results.abstract: Colombians continued to protest on Wednesday for an eighth day in a row, demanding an end to inequality, corruption and the economic devastation caused by the coronavirus.
results.byline: BY THE ASSOCIATED PRESS AND REUTERS

results.title: India’s Coronavirus Crisis Overwhelms Health System
results.abstract: The frightening surge of coronavirus cases in India has overwhelmed many hospitals in recent days, at times forcing staff members to provide medical treatment inside ambulances while patients wait for beds.
results.byline: BY REUTERS

multimedia.caption: Lilaben Gautambhai Modi, 80, sitting in an ambulance today as she waits to enter a hospital for Covid-19 treatment, in Ahmedabad, India.

results.title: Canada authorizes Pfizer’s vaccine for adolescents, but shots won’t begin immediately.
results.abstract: Clinical trials showed that the vaccine, codeveloped with BioNTech, was safe for 12- to 15-year-olds, Canada’s regulatory agency said.

results.title: She Kept Madrid Open in the Pandemic. Voters Rewarded Her.
results.abstract: Isabel Díaz Ayuso, a conservative politician dubbed a “Trumpista” by her opponents, won the Madrid regional election by a landslide after she refused to shut down the capital’s bars and shops.
results.byline: BY RAPHAEL MINDER
